list_definition.definition: to cut (grass etc) with a scythe or mower

list_ex_of_english: In our experiment, the regenerative capacity of thistles was considerably lower than that of clover when ryegrass- clover ley was mowed and/or mulched.
The rye was mown and incorporated into the soil by disking in spring 2003.
The functions of shepherd, pigman, cowman, and so on, must have been more specialised, and 'labourers' could be engaged in more general tasks, probably mowing and haymaking as well.
A mowing machine, not defined in legislation, is considered to be a vehicle designed and constructed purely for cutting grass.
They also maintained their orchard floors by mowing resident vegetation and avoiding or reducing tillage, which can be a money-saving strategy.
Grandsons often did chores such as cutting wood, mowing grass or providing transport.
Residues were mown prior to corn planting and after corn harvest.
With their wide, wasteful verges which have to be expensively mown, they use up 40 acres a mile.
